title: 109_s1791
content: The "Timber Tax Act of 2005" allows for a deduction for qualified timber gain under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Timber Tax Act of 2005 allows a deduction for qualified timber gain, where taxpayers can deduct 60% of their qualified timber gain or net capital gain. Qualified timber gain is the excess of gains over losses from timber activities. Pass-thru entities must make the election separately. The Timber Tax Act of 2005 allows a deduction for qualified timber gain, where taxpayers can deduct 60% of their qualified timber gain or net capital gain. Pass-thru entities must make the election separately for tax on such gain. Coordination with maximum capital gains rates is also addressed in the amendment to section 1(h) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Timber Tax Act of 2005 allows a deduction for qualified timber gain, where taxpayers can deduct 60% of their qualified timber gain or net capital gain. Corporations with an election under section 1203 can reduce their net capital gain by the qualified timber gain. The deduction is allowed in computing adjusted current earnings. The Timber Tax Act of 2005 allows a deduction for qualified timber gain under section 1203 in computing adjusted current earnings and taxable income for electing small business trusts. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code to accommodate this deduction. Amendments are made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code regarding the exclusion and deduction under sections 1202 and 1203 for estates and trusts. Amendments are made to sections of the Internal Revenue Code regarding the exclusion and deduction under sections 1202 and 1203 for estates and trusts. Section 643(a)(6)(C) is amended for foreign trusts, including gains and losses from the sale of capital assets. Section 691(c)(4) is amended to include section 1203, and section 871(a)(2) is also amended. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include inserting "and 1203" after "section 1202" in paragraph (2) of section 871(a) and adding a new item to the table of sections for part I of subchapter P of chapter 1. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after the enactment date. For taxable years including the enactment date, the taxpayer's qualified timber gain is limited to dispositions of timber after that date.
